[File: storage/jellyfish-merkle/src/mock_tree_store.rs] [Field: allow_overwrite] [Flag inconsistency] Can allow_overwrite be changed after construction, or is it immutable? If mutable, could concurrent threads observe different flag values causing inconsistent behavior? (Medium)

[File: storage/jellyfish-merkle/src/mock_tree_store.rs] [Field: allow_overwrite] [Test/production mismatch] Is allow_overwrite=true only used in tests, or can production code accidentally enable it, allowing state corruption by permitting duplicate node insertions? (High)

[File: storage/jellyfish-merkle/src/mock_tree_store.rs] [Field: allow_overwrite] [Silent corruption] Can allow_overwrite=true mask critical bugs by silently replacing nodes that should never be duplicated, hiding state corruption until production deployment? (High)

[File: storage/jellyfish-merkle/src/mock_tree_store.rs] [Implementation: Default] [Flag default] Does defaulting allow_overwrite to false at line 22 prevent legitimate use cases where overwrites are needed, or is this the correct security-first default? (Low)

[File: storage/jellyfish-merkle/src/mock_tree_store.rs] [Cross-function] [Purge during read] Can purge_stale_nodes() delete a node that get_node_option() has already looked up but not yet cloned, returning None when the node should exist? (High)

[File: storage/jellyfish-merkle/src/mock_tree_store.rs] [Cross-function] [Batch vs single] Can interleaved calls to write_node_batch() and put_node() violate the assert_eq! at line 64, even though both are legitimate operations? (Medium)

[File: storage/jellyfish-merkle/src/mock_tree_store.rs] [Cross-function] [Stale index orphan] If write_tree_update_batch() fails after inserting nodes but before adding stale indices, can orphaned nodes accumulate without pruning indices, causing unbounded storage growth? (High)

[File: storage/jellyfish-merkle/src/mock_tree_store.rs] [Cross-function] [Count divergence] Can concurrent purge_stale_nodes() and write_node_batch() operations cause num_nodes() to return counts that never reflect actual stored nodes? (Low)

[File: storage/jellyfish-merkle/src/mock_tree_store.rs] [State consistency] [HashMap-BTreeSet sync] Can the HashMap and BTreeSet in the data tuple fall out of sync if one operation succeeds but its pair fails, causing stale indices to point to non-existent nodes? (Critical)

[File: storage/jellyfish-merkle/src/mock_tree_store.rs] [State consistency] [Version ordering] Does MockTreeStore enforce that all nodes at version V are inserted before any nodes at version V+1, or can out-of-order inserts corrupt version-based queries? (High)

[File: storage/jellyfish-merkle/src/mock_tree_store.rs] [State consistency] [Root node handling] Does MockTreeStore specially validate root nodes (empty nibble path), or can malformed root nodes break the entire tree structure? (High)

[File: storage/jellyfish-merkle/src/mock_tree_store.rs] [State consistency] [Leaf vs internal] Can Internal nodes be stored with NodeKeys that should contain Leaf nodes, violating Merkle tree structure invariants? (High)
